comments.en:
This printer was made in 1984. It's basicly a dot matrix printer with an inkjet print head. It takes tractor feed paper. I set it up as text only in printtool.

For basic printing functionality use the HPIJS driver . For advanced functionality such as printer status and maintenance features, use the HPLIP driver (which includes HPIJS).

In CUPS set up a raw (=unfiltered) queue with:

lpadmin -p thinkjet -E -v parallel:/dev/lp0

Note that you get a raw queue when you do not provide a PPD file.

It is rated as "Partially" working because there must be a possibility to print graphics with it.
